questions.question: What is the primary focus of the Secret Book of John?
choices: A historical account of John the Apostle
A Gnostic creation myth and cosmology
A collection of sayings attributed to Jesus
A critique of orthodox Christianity
questions.answer: A Gnostic creation myth and cosmology

questions.question: In the Secret Book of John, who is responsible for creating the material world?
choices: The invisible Spirit
Sophia
Yaldabaoth
Barbelo
questions.answer: Yaldabaoth

questions.question: What is the Pleroma in Gnostic thought?
choices: The material world
The realm of evil spirits
The fullness of the divine realm
The human soul
questions.answer: The fullness of the divine realm

questions.question: Who is Sophia in the Secret Book of John?
choices: The supreme deity
The mother of Yaldabaoth
The first human
The wife of John
questions.answer: The mother of Yaldabaoth

questions.question: What is a Demiurge in Gnostic belief?
choices: A divine messenger
A lower divine being responsible for creating the material world
A human prophet
An angelic being
questions.answer: A lower divine being responsible for creating the material world

questions.question: How does the Secret Book of John's creation story differ from Genesis?
choices: It involves multiple divine beings
It describes creation in seven days
It portrays the creator as wholly good
It focuses on the creation of plants and animals
questions.answer: It involves multiple divine beings

questions.question: What are Archons in Gnostic texts?
choices: Divine messengers
Human rulers
Malevolent authorities in the material world
Heavenly bodies
questions.answer: Malevolent authorities in the material world

questions.question: What is the significance of gnosis in the Secret Book of John?
choices: It refers to scientific knowledge
It is a type of ritual practice
It is divine knowledge that leads to salvation
It is a form of political power
questions.answer: It is divine knowledge that leads to salvation

questions.question: How is Yaldabaoth portrayed in the Secret Book of John?
choices: As a benevolent creator
As an ignorant and arrogant being
As a wise teacher
As a human prophet
questions.answer: As an ignorant and arrogant being

questions.question: What is the role of Barbelo in the Secret Book of John?
choices: The first emanation from the invisible Spirit
The creator of the material world
A human disciple of John
The ruler of the Archons
questions.answer: The first emanation from the invisible Spirit

questions.question: How does the Secret Book of John explain the existence of evil?
choices: As a necessary balance to good
As a result of human free will
As a consequence of the material world's creation by a flawed being
As a test from the supreme deity
questions.answer: As a consequence of the material world's creation by a flawed being

questions.question: What are Aeons in Gnostic cosmology?
choices: Human spiritual leaders
Divine beings or emanations from the supreme deity
Evil spirits that oppose humanity
Physical planets in the universe
questions.answer: Divine beings or emanations from the supreme deity

questions.question: How does the Secret Book of John view the material world?
choices: As a perfect creation of a benevolent god
As an illusion to be transcended
As a flawed creation of a lower divine being
As the only true reality
questions.answer: As a flawed creation of a lower divine being

questions.question: What is the ultimate goal for humans according to the Secret Book of John?
choices: To accumulate material wealth
To achieve political power
To return to the Pleroma through gnosis
To multiply and populate the earth
questions.answer: To return to the Pleroma through gnosis

questions.question: How does the Secret Book of John portray the God of the Old Testament?
choices: As the supreme, benevolent deity
As Yaldabaoth, a lower, flawed creator
As Sophia, the divine wisdom
As Barbelo, the first emanation
questions.answer: As Yaldabaoth, a lower, flawed creator

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'fall of Sophia' in the Secret Book of John?
choices: It leads to the creation of the material world
It represents human sin
It describes the origin of death
It explains the creation of angels
questions.answer: It leads to the creation of the material world

questions.question: How does the Secret Book of John view human beings?
choices: As purely physical creatures
As spiritual beings trapped in material bodies
As perfect creations of a benevolent god
As inherently evil beings
questions.answer: As spiritual beings trapped in material bodies

questions.question: What role does Jesus play in the Secret Book of John?
choices: He is the creator of the world
He is a divine revealer of gnosis
He is portrayed as a purely human teacher
He is not mentioned in the text
questions.answer: He is a divine revealer of gnosis

questions.question: How does the Secret Book of John explain the creation of humanity?
choices: As a direct creation by the supreme deity
As an evolutionary process
As a creation by Yaldabaoth, inspired by a divine image
As a spontaneous emergence from the earth
questions.answer: As a creation by Yaldabaoth, inspired by a divine image

questions.question: What is the significance of 'light' in the Secret Book of John?
choices: It represents physical illumination
It symbolizes divine knowledge and truth
It refers to the sun and stars
It represents the material world
questions.answer: It symbolizes divine knowledge and truth

questions.question: How does the Secret Book of John differ from orthodox Christian teachings?
choices: It rejects the concept of salvation
It portrays the creator god as flawed
It denies the existence of Jesus
It emphasizes the importance of material wealth
questions.answer: It portrays the creator god as flawed

choices: To replace traditional Timorese beliefs
To understand early Christian diversity
To promote Gnosticism as the true religion
To discredit orthodox Christianity
questions.answer: To understand early Christian diversity

questions.question: How might the Secret Book of John's view of evil relate to Timorese understanding of suffering?
choices: It provides a cosmic explanation for the existence of suffering
It denies the reality of suffering
It blames individuals for their own suffering
It promotes acceptance of suffering as necessary

questions.question: What is the significance of 'knowledge' in the Secret Book of John?
choices: It refers to scientific understanding
It is seen as dangerous and forbidden
It is the key to spiritual liberation
It is considered irrelevant to salvation

questions.question: How does the Secret Book of John view the relationship between spirit and matter?
choices: As harmonious and integrated
As opposing forces
As identical concepts
As irrelevant to human existence
questions.answer: As opposing forces

questions.question: What is the role of self-knowledge in the Secret Book of John?
choices: It is discouraged as selfish
It is seen as a path to knowing the divine
It is considered irrelevant
It is viewed as a form of pride

questions.question: How does the Secret Book of John portray the concept of salvation?
choices: As achieved through good works
As predetermined by divine will
As attained through gnosis and return to the Pleroma
As impossible for humans to achieve

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'invisible Spirit' in the Secret Book of John?
choices: It is the lowest form of divinity
It is the supreme, unknowable deity
It is another name for Yaldabaoth
It represents human consciousness
questions.answer: It is the supreme, unknowable deity

questions.question: How might the study of the Secret Book of John contribute to interfaith dialogue in Timor-Leste?
choices: By promoting Gnosticism over other faiths
By encouraging the rejection of all religious beliefs
By fostering understanding of diverse spiritual perspectives
By emphasizing the superiority of ancient texts
questions.answer: By fostering understanding of diverse spiritual perspectives

questions.question: What is the significance of the term 'secret' in the title 'Secret Book of John'?
choices: It implies the text was hidden from authorities
It suggests the teachings are only for a select few
It indicates the book was written in code
It means the author is unknown
questions.answer: It suggests the teachings are only for a select few
